criteria: Accuracy in evaluating expressions with variables
Ability to apply the correct order of operations
Correct use of formulas in real-world problems
descriptions: Does not attempt to evaluate the expression or makes fundamental errors demonstrating a lack of understanding of variable substitution.
Attempts to evaluate the expression but makes significant arithmetic errors or misunderstands the order of operations.
Evaluates the expression with some errors in arithmetic or order of operations, showing partial understanding of variable substitution.
Evaluates the expression with minor errors, demonstrating a general understanding of variable substitution and order of operations.
Accurately evaluates the expression, showing a strong understanding of variable substitution and order of operations.
Accurately and efficiently evaluates the expression, demonstrating a comprehensive understanding and can explain the process clearly.
Demonstrates no understanding of the order of operations.
Shows limited understanding of the order of operations, often performing operations in the incorrect sequence.
Applies the order of operations with inconsistencies, making errors in some steps but not others.
Generally applies the correct order of operations but may make minor errors or omissions.
Consistently applies the correct order of operations to accurately evaluate expressions.
Masterfully applies the correct order of operations, including complex expressions, and can justify each step.
Unable to identify or apply the given formula in the context of the problem.
Attempts to use the formula but makes significant errors in substitution or application.
Applies the formula with some errors, demonstrating a partial understanding of its use in the problem.
Applies the formula correctly but may make minor errors in calculation or interpretation of the result.
Correctly applies the formula and accurately interprets the result in the context of the real-world problem.
Demonstrates a thorough understanding of the formula and its application, providing a clear and insightful interpretation of the result in the real-world context.
